intro: Dendrocnide densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered stinging tree, is a species of flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many plants with stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its stinging hairs can cause severe skin irritation in humans and animals. It typically grows in rainforest or wetland areas, thriving in humid, tropical climates.
